subject: Photography
title: Manual Focus: When Humans Win
description: One-minute skill: Manual Focus: When Humans Win.

hook.text: Autofocus is brilliant. But sometimes it's confused, fooled, or just too slow. Then your hands take over.

buildup.text: Manual focus lets you twist the lens ring to set focus precisely where you want it, bypassing all automation.

discovery.text: Macro photography, astrophotography, and focus stacking all demand manual control that autofocus can't provide.

twist.text: Focus peaking highlights sharp edges in color on your screen, making manual focus faster and more accurate.

climax.text: Manual focus isn't outdated ‚Äî it's a precision tool for situations where the machine needs a human brain.

quiz.question: When is manual focus typically preferred over autofocus?
options: In macro, astro, and precision situations where AF struggles
